result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leslie R. Burgess

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leslie R. Burgess in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea to Count 1 in 15CM220. 
Per DA Snider, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty regarding Count 1 in 15Cm220. 
Count 2 and 15CM215 are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders 45 days jail, imposed/stayed, probation 1 year. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
of Potential Conflict of Interest - Leslie Burgess and Vicki Jerge
To Atty Tom Johnson with amended signature bonds to be returned with signature of defendant both cases 15CM215 and 15CM220 - copies of letter/ bonds sent to WCSO and Jail Sgt

Amended on 07/28/15 to remove No contact provision with VLJ. 
Other provisions remain the same:Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
Defendant can go upon premises only today to retrieve his car
Can go one time only accompanied by law enforcement to retrieve any personal belongings.

  Plea Not Guilty

Granted by the Court.

Court finds defendant waives his rights to an atty.
Defendant will be residing with his brother.
Court will not accept guilty plea at this time.
